RESEARCH REPORT: TRON Ecosystem Stablecoins

TRON is now the world‚Äôs 2nd largest stablecoin network, with $80B+ of stablecoin supply, $20B in daily stablecoin volume, and over 2 million stablecoin transactions each day.

In collaboration with the TRON DAO team, we produced a report on TRON stablecoin activity, to study how stablecoin usage on TRON has grown over the past 5 years. Summary below:
Since 2021, TRON‚Äôs stablecoin supply has grown nearly 10x. Additionally, it remained resilient through the 2022‚Äì23 bear market while Ethereum‚Äôs share notably contracted.

Today, TRON is Tether‚Äôs most active settlement layer and dominates in large-value stablecoin transfers. 
TRON‚Äôs edge is cost efficiency: median stablecoin transfer fees of $0.09 vs $3.73 for Ethereum, with confirmation times also 4x faster.

This makes TRON the preferred rail for mid-to-large value transfers, where speed and cost efficiency matter. 
Flow data shows that 60‚Äì80% of stablecoin inflows on TRON go directly to centralized services, with Binance capturing up to 50%.

Compared to Ethereum, TRON is used relatively less for DeFi and relatively more as a high-throughput settlement layer, particularly for moving capital between trading platforms.
Activity is concentrated in Asia and emerging markets, with daily supply velocity of 0.2 - 0.3x regardless of market cycles.

Thanks to low fees and swift confirmations, TRON is now core infrastructure for global USDT transfers.

As we move into 2026, Vitalik Buterin is doubling down on a long-term roadmap that prioritizes stability over hype. His latest comparison of #Ethereum to Linux and BitTorrent signals a shift from "crypto product" to a foundational "world computer."
+1

The Strategic Logic:

Boring is Better: Just as Linux quietly powers the global internet, Ethereum aims to be the invisible infrastructure for finance and identity. It doesn't need to be "loud" to be indispensable.

The "Walkaway Test": In his January 2026 manifesto, Vitalik emphasized that true dApps must function without fraud or censorship, even if their developers disappear. This is the ultimate "trustless" benchmark.

Technical Milestones: With the Fusaka upgrade complete and Glamsterdam (H1 2026) on the horizon, technologies like PeerDAS and ZK-EVMs have officially solved the blockchain trilemma in live code.

The Takeaway: Ethereum isn't just "another L1" anymore. It‚Äôs positioning itself as a neutral, decentralized foundation that reduces counterparty risk for both individuals and sovereign institutions. Adoption may not be explosive, but it's becoming deeply embedded.

Interoperability push SWIFT integrating blockchain messaging, public permissioned L2s with ZK proofs, and bridges to public chains to unlock global liquidity without fragmentation.

Crypto liquidity is next: As banks connect to open ecosystems, expect deeper pools, better price discovery, and capital rotation into tokenized assets & DeFi rails.
